thread.title: Class 8 Used Truck Volumes Drop M/M, Grow Y/Y in August
thread.title_full: Class 8 Used Truck Volumes Drop M/M, Grow Y/Y in August

title: Class 8 Used Truck Volumes Drop M/M, Grow Y/Y in August
text:
Class 8 Used Truck Volumes Drop M/M, Grow Y/Y in August September 28, 2015, 06:59 AM Related: ACT Research , Class 8 , Commercial Vehicles , Trucks 
Used Class 8 truck metrics were generally in line on a year-to-date basis, but all except volumes fell slightly when compared m/m and y/y. Volumes lost 7% m/m, but were up 2% y/y, while average mileage decreased 3% and 5%, respectively. The average age of U.S. Class 8 used trucks decreased to 91 months, while average prices slipped 1% y/y and 2% m/m, despite remaining strong at 5% YTD, according to the latest release of the State of the Industry: U.S. Classes 3-8 Used Trucks, published by ACT Research.“Used truck sales remain strong and dealers are working very hard to find used truck inventory, but some downward adjustment of use truck prices is occurring,” said Steve Tam, ACT’s Vice President-Commercial Vehicle Sector. Tam added, “Volumes in the retail market posted weaker numbers in August, down 4% m/m. Auction and wholesale markets continued their downward tracks, decreasing 3% and 17%, respectively.” Today's Other News
